research_source: Web search aggregation (1000logos.net, Typewolf, Google Fonts, FontFabric, dafont forums)
note: Perplexity API returned 401 (Cloudflare proxy block). Research conducted via web search and direct source analysis.

letterform_characteristics.geometry: Clean geometric with strict cuts and distinctive contours
letterform_characteristics.special_features: Rounded lines combined with straight cuts, prominent circular O forms

logo_evolution.1964_1996: Stacked vertical wordmark with decorative strokes, unusual H middle bar
logo_evolution.1996: Rounded terminals replaced by square cuts, decorative strokes removed
logo_evolution.1997_2005: First single-line composition, additional glyph spacing, lighter weight, prominent circular Os
logo_evolution.2005_2018: Further refinement, lighter weight, more proportional letterforms
logo_evolution.2018_present: Minimalist black-and-white, timeless geometric sans-serif, suitable for tags, packaging, digital

tier_1_best_match.why: Inspired by 1920s German geometric sans-serifs (Paul Renner / Futura lineage). Clean Bauhaus geometry with wide letter-spacing support. Circular O, strict geometric construction. Best overall match for Topshop's modern geometric identity.

Grotesque sans-serif designed for digital high-performance. Strong geometric bones with slightly humanist terminals. Excellent in all-caps display at large sizes. Very close to Neue Helvetica proportions.

tier_2_strong_alternatives.why: Geometric sans inspired by Buenos Aires signage. Wide weight range. Strong uppercase display presence. Already in existing brand config as a candidate.
Closest in design impression to Helvetica Neue for display/heading use. Optimized for screen. Clean geometry with subtle humanist warmth.
Hybrid geometric-grotesque. Very close to Neue Helvetica in proportions and stroke contrast. Corporate precision that reads as high-end.

tier_3_display_condensed.why: Tall condensed sans-serif. Striking in all-caps display. More editorial/poster feel than the Topshop wordmark, but excellent for campaign headlines and overlays.
Alternate Gothic style condensed. Strong headline impact. Good for campaign taglines where vertical compression is desired.

primary_headline.rationale: Closest geometric match to Topshop wordmark. Wide tracking mirrors the brand's tracked-out identity. Bauhaus heritage aligns with Topshop's modernist editorial DNA.

secondary_headline.rationale: Condensed display for high-impact campaign taglines. Creates visual contrast with the primary headline without breaking geometric consistency.

body_support.rationale: Clean Helvetica-adjacent reading font for any body copy or small print overlays.
